channel.title: Comments on: How to insert information into multiple related tables and return ID using SQLDataSource
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: frank
item.dc:creator: frank
item.description:
Could you please do an example with 2 or 4 tables I have tables like this:
CREATE TABLE tblUsersFK ( user_id INT IDENTITY (1,1) PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, user_gebruikersnaam NVARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, user_password NVARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, user_type_id INT NOT NULL, user_taal_id INT NOT NULL, user_uurrooster_id INT NOT NULL
)
PRINT ' tblUsersFK' GO
CREATE TABLE tblUsergegevensFK ( user_id INT CONSTRAINT usGegeUser_fk FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES tblUsersFK (user_id), --user_id INT IDENTITY (1,1) PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, userg_voornaam NVARCHAR(50), userg_achternaam NVARCHAR(50), userg_geboortedatum NVARCHAR(50), userg_rijksregister NVARCHAR(50), userg_geslacht_id INT NOT NULL, userg_straat NVARCHAR(50), userg_gemeente_zipcode INT NOT NULL ) PRINT ' tblUsergegevensFK' GO
and i want to insert data into the tables using stored procedures.
--Insert Stored procedure for User
IF OBJECT_ID('usgsp_UserInsert') IS NOT NULL BEGIN DROP PROC usp_UserInsert END GO CREATE PROCEDURE usp_UserInsert -- @user_id INT , @user_gebruikersnaam NVARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, @user_password NVARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, @user_type_id INT NOT NULL, @user_taal_id INT NOT NULL, @user_uurrooster_id INT NOT NULL AS BEGIN INSERT INTO tblUser ( user_gebruikersnaam , user_password , user_type_id , user_taal_id , user_uurrooster_id )
VALUES ( @user_gebruikersnaam , @user_password , @user_type_id , @user_taal_id , @user_uurrooster_id ) END GO
--- ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;; -- Update stored proc for User -- User Update Stored Procedure
IF OBJECT_ID('cusp_UserUpdate') IS NOT NULL BEGIN DROP PROC cusp_UserUpdate END GO CREATE PROC cusp_UserUpdate @user_id INT , @user_gebruikersnaam NVARCHAR(50) , @user_password NVARCHAR(50) , @user_type_id INT , @user_taal_id INT , @user_uurrooster_id INT
AS BEGIN
UPDATE tblUser SET user_gebruikersnaam = @user_gebruikersnaam , user_password = @user_password , user_type_id = @user_type_id , user_taal_id = @user_taal_id , user_uurrooster_id = @user_uurrooster_id
WHERE user_id = @user_id END GO
-- :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: --Insert Stored procedure for Usergegevens
IF OBJECT_ID('usgsp_UsergegevensInsert') IS NOT NULL BEGIN DROP PROC usp_UsergegevensInsert END GO CREATE PROCEDURE usp_UsergegevensInsert -- @user_id INT , @userg_voornaam NVARCHAR(50), @userg_achternaam NVARCHAR(50), @userg_geboortedatum NVARCHAR(50), @userg_rijksregister NVARCHAR(50), @userg_geslacht_id INT NOT NULL, @userg_straat NVARCHAR(50), @userg_gemeente_zipcode INT NOT NULL AS BEGIN INSERT INTO tblUsergegevens ( userg_voornaam , userg_achternaam , userg_geboortedatum , userg_rijksregister , userg_geslacht_id , userg_straat , userg_gemeente_zipcode
)
VALUES( @userg_voornaam , @userg_achternaam , @userg_geboortedatum , @userg_rijksregister , @userg_geslacht_id , @userg_straat , @userg_gemeente_zipcode ) END GO /* SET @user_id = SCOPE_IDENTITY()
SELECT userg_voornaam = @userg_voornaam userg_achternaam = @userg_achternaam userg_geboortedatum = @userg_geboortedatum userg_rijksregister = @userg_rijksregister userg_geslacht_id = @userg_geslacht_id userg_straat = @userg_straat userg_gemeente_zipcode = @userg_gemeente_zipcode FROM tblUsergegevens WHERE user_id = @user_id END -- */
--- ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;; -- Update stored proc van Usergegevens -- Usergegevens Update Stored Procedure
IF OBJECT_ID('cusp_UsergegevensUpdate') IS NOT NULL BEGIN DROP PROC cusp_UsergegevensUpdate END GO CREATE PROC cusp_UsergegevensUpdate @user_id INT , @userg_voornaam NVARCHAR(50), @userg_achternaam NVARCHAR(50), @userg_geboortedatum NVARCHAR(50), @userg_rijksregister NVARCHAR(50), @userg_geslacht_id INT, @userg_straat NVARCHAR(50), @userg_gemeente_zipcode INT
AS BEGIN
UPDATE tblUsergegevens SET userg_voornaam = @userg_voornaam , userg_achternaam = @userg_achternaam , userg_geboortedatum = @userg_geboortedatum, userg_rijksregister = @userg_rijksregister, userg_geslacht_id = @userg_geslacht_id, userg_straat = @userg_straat , userg_gemeente_zipcode = @userg_gemeente_zipcode
WHERE user_id = @user_id END GO
+ is it also a good idea to create stored procedure for static tables like Langauge(s), Gender, title(s) (like Mr, Mrs)....
Very new to this just don't understand it well so far ?
Btw: great example i don't really understand it.
item.content:encoded:
Could you please do an example with 2 or 4 tables
I have tables like this:

CREATE TABLE tblUsersFK
(
user_id INT IDENTITY (1,1) PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,
user_gebruikersnaam NVARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
user_password NVARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
user_type_id INT NOT NULL,
user_taal_id INT NOT NULL,
user_uurrooster_id INT NOT NULL

)

PRINT ‘ tblUsersFK’
GO

CREATE TABLE tblUsergegevensFK
(
user_id INT CONSTRAINT usGegeUser_fk FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES tblUsersFK (user_id),
–user_id INT IDENTITY (1,1) PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,
userg_voornaam NVARCHAR(50),
userg_achternaam NVARCHAR(50),
userg_geboortedatum NVARCHAR(50),
userg_rijksregister NVARCHAR(50),
userg_geslacht_id INT NOT NULL,
userg_straat NVARCHAR(50),
userg_gemeente_zipcode INT NOT NULL
)
PRINT ‘ tblUsergegevensFK’
GO

and i want to insert data into the tables using stored procedures.

–Insert Stored procedure for User

IF OBJECT_ID(‘usgsp_UserInsert’) IS NOT NULL
BEGIN
DROP PROC usp_UserInsert
END
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE usp_UserInsert
— @user_id INT ,
@user_gebruikersnaam NVARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
@user_password NVARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
@user_type_id INT NOT NULL,
@user_taal_id INT NOT NULL,
@user_uurrooster_id INT NOT NULL
AS
BEGIN
INSERT INTO tblUser (
user_gebruikersnaam ,
user_password ,
user_type_id ,
user_taal_id ,
user_uurrooster_id )

VALUES (
@user_gebruikersnaam ,
@user_password ,
@user_type_id ,
@user_taal_id ,
@user_uurrooster_id )
END
GO

— ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
— Update stored proc for User
— User Update Stored Procedure

IF OBJECT_ID(‘cusp_UserUpdate’) IS NOT NULL
BEGIN
DROP PROC cusp_UserUpdate
END
GO
CREATE PROC cusp_UserUpdate
@user_id INT ,
@user_gebruikersnaam NVARCHAR(50) ,
@user_password NVARCHAR(50) ,
@user_type_id INT ,
@user_taal_id INT ,
@user_uurrooster_id INT

AS
BEGIN

UPDATE tblUser
SET
user_gebruikersnaam = @user_gebruikersnaam ,
user_password = @user_password ,
user_type_id = @user_type_id ,
user_taal_id = @user_taal_id ,
user_uurrooster_id = @user_uurrooster_id

WHERE user_id = @user_id
END
GO

— ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
–Insert Stored procedure for Usergegevens

IF OBJECT_ID(‘usgsp_UsergegevensInsert’) IS NOT NULL
BEGIN
DROP PROC usp_UsergegevensInsert
END
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE usp_UsergegevensInsert
— @user_id INT ,
@userg_voornaam NVARCHAR(50),
@userg_achternaam NVARCHAR(50),
@userg_geboortedatum NVARCHAR(50),
@userg_rijksregister NVARCHAR(50),
@userg_geslacht_id INT NOT NULL,
@userg_straat NVARCHAR(50),
@userg_gemeente_zipcode INT NOT NULL
AS
BEGIN
INSERT INTO tblUsergegevens (
userg_voornaam ,
userg_achternaam ,
userg_geboortedatum ,
userg_rijksregister ,
userg_geslacht_id ,
userg_straat ,
userg_gemeente_zipcode

)

VALUES(
@userg_voornaam ,
@userg_achternaam ,
@userg_geboortedatum ,
@userg_rijksregister ,
@userg_geslacht_id ,
@userg_straat ,
@userg_gemeente_zipcode )
END
GO
/*
SET @user_id = SCOPE_IDENTITY()

SELECT
userg_voornaam = @userg_voornaam
userg_achternaam = @userg_achternaam
userg_geboortedatum = @userg_geboortedatum
userg_rijksregister = @userg_rijksregister
userg_geslacht_id = @userg_geslacht_id
userg_straat = @userg_straat
userg_gemeente_zipcode = @userg_gemeente_zipcode
FROM tblUsergegevens
WHERE user_id = @user_id
END
—
*/

— ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
— Update stored proc van Usergegevens
— Usergegevens Update Stored Procedure

IF OBJECT_ID(‘cusp_UsergegevensUpdate’) IS NOT NULL
BEGIN
DROP PROC cusp_UsergegevensUpdate
END
GO
CREATE PROC cusp_UsergegevensUpdate
@user_id INT ,
@userg_voornaam NVARCHAR(50),
@userg_achternaam NVARCHAR(50),
@userg_geboortedatum NVARCHAR(50),
@userg_rijksregister NVARCHAR(50),
@userg_geslacht_id INT,
@userg_straat NVARCHAR(50),
@userg_gemeente_zipcode INT

AS
BEGIN

UPDATE tblUsergegevens
SET
userg_voornaam = @userg_voornaam ,
userg_achternaam = @userg_achternaam ,
userg_geboortedatum = @userg_geboortedatum,
userg_rijksregister = @userg_rijksregister,
userg_geslacht_id = @userg_geslacht_id,
userg_straat = @userg_straat ,
userg_gemeente_zipcode = @userg_gemeente_zipcode

WHERE user_id = @user_id
END
GO

+ is it also a good idea to create stored procedure for static tables like Langauge(s), Gender, title(s) (like Mr, Mrs)….

Very new to this just don’t understand it well so far ?

Btw: great example i don’t really understand it.

item.description: I want to have a reply and like button for every comment on my website's posts with autoincrement for everytime is liked. Please help out. Thanks.
item.content:encoded: I want to have a reply and like button for every comment on my website’s posts with autoincrement for everytime is liked. Please help out. Thanks.

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.content:encoded:
Neville,

I used this SP in our ASP.NET application using FormView and SQLDataSource. I can post some relevant code in this blog, but perhaps in may be better if you can post this question on ASP.NET forums (in SQLDataSource forum) and send me a PM asking to look at that thread.

item.title: By: Neville Stewart
item.dc:creator: Neville Stewart
item.content:encoded:
Thanks Naomi,

Also, can you point me in the right direction for information on using this SP in an asp.net web application? Basically I’m not sure if I should be using say FormView, which allows me to insert records into a table. In this case, I need to insert records into two tables using a single web form.

Thanks!

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.content:encoded:
Neville,

I posted the real sample of my SP, I didn’t have a simpler sample. However, the principle is still the same.

If you need to insert records into two related tables, you wrap both inserts into transaction. You first insert into Parent table, then grab the ID (preferably using OUTPUT clause of Insert statement, not SCOPE_IDENTITY() as this sample shows). In addition, you may want to use TRY/CATCH to catch the errors if any.

item.title: By: Neville Stewart
item.dc:creator: Neville Stewart
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for posting this. This looks like it solves my dilema for inserting data into multiple tables when registering say, a new student into a school. Can you please post an example using just two tables, and a less number of fields so I can fully understand the steps you took? In specific, the steps you took after creating the stored procedure.

Thanks again,

What a good sql language you have shown us here.

Please write more stored procedure for people to see.
